storyInfo: Shaw fails to save a man trapped in a fire. The only thing he left behind was a stamp album.

attributes.content: There was a fire at a residential building downtown.
Everyone, don'tpanic! Pleasefollowourinstructions andevacuatetooutside thecordonedoffarea. Donotpanic...
attributes.name: Shaw

attributes.content: It's gone... My life savings... all gone...
Hahaha... That's what I'm talking about! Burn this whole stinking place to the ground! Hahahaha...
Clear a path! Use triage! Care for the heavily injured first!
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Chief, no sign of anyone still trapped.
attributes.name: L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Everyone, please take a look around and see if there's anyone you know who hasn't evacuated?
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Has anyone seen the weird guy who lives on the second floor...?
attributes.name: Female Resident

attributes.content: Right, now that you mention it, I don't think I've seen him.
attributes.name: Male Resident

attributes.content: The second floor? Isn't that where the fire started?
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: That doesn’t sound good. Do you know if he's home?
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: He leaves his blinds open every time he goes out, but his blinds were closed when I came down the stairs just now.
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Tell HQ! There's someone trapped inside. The fire has grown so big that the firefighters can't go back in. Send fire trucks. Right now—
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: The fire’s probably from an Originium fire starter explosion. It might set off a chain reaction any minutet—
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Stay in contact... and be careful.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Shaw, how’s it going in there...?
attributes.name: Comms

attributes.content: Shaw, give me a status report.
attributes.name: Comms

attributes.content: Shaw, don't push yourself. If you can't get inside, come back down right away!
attributes.name: Comms

attributes.content: The tiny Zalak slams on the burning hot steel door with her shoulder. It doesn't bulge.
Sparks fly everywhere. Shaw's axe turns scalding hot from the heat of the fire.
She tightly grips her axe's handle and slams it toward the door's lock. The fissure on the lock is already clear.
You scared the hell out of me. I’m glad you’re awake...
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: And don't worry. The fire's out. You did great.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: But now I’m worried about you. The medic says you breathed in a little too much carbon monoxide. You need to get some rest.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Don't move too much, and keep your oxygen mask on.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Oh, wait! Whataboutthatguy?! Whathappened totheguywhowastrapped inthebuilding?! Igotta—
attributes.name: Shaw

attributes.content: Shaw never expected to find such a small room behind the door.
Everything inside has been burned to ashes, which in turn makes the room look that much more open.
There is a safe in the corner of the room. Although warped from the heat, its contents are miraculously intact.
A small stack of LMD bills and a stamp album.
The fire erupted so quickly. In the end, one person died, with eleven in critical condition.
That was the first time I saw a life extinguished right before my eyes.
I got distracted during training; got reprimanded. Had to write a self-reflection report.

The investigation into the fire the other day has wrapped up. It was started by a worn-out home-use Originium fire starter device, which set off a chain of explosions. The residents had too many things strewn around the building, which helped the fire spread.
I was commended at the ceremony today.
Right. You were there yourself. His whole life was burned to a crisp. There weren't any clues for us to work with.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: We asked around in the neighborhood. All we learned is that the deceased was a single male. No idea what he did for a living or what his relationships were like.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: We put a notice in the papers asking anyone to come forward to claim his remains. We still haven't heard from anyone.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: That's not something we have to worry about.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Oh, that thing, huh? We looked into it.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: No idea why he kept it in the safe, but analysis shows it's just a normal stamp album. There aren't even any fingerprints. We couldn't find any leads at all.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Why are you still asking about the fire, Shaw? The investigation must be over by now.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: It was a home-use Originium fire starter that burned the place down. Both the L.G.D. and fire department arrived at that conclusion. There's nothing suspicious about it.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: If we go by the book, we're supposed to destroy all personal effects left behind by nameless victims. I could give it to you, but what for?
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: *Sigh*, what do I do with you... Come with me.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: The guy who lived on the second floor? Didn't you ask me just a couple days ago? I didn't know him!
attributes.name: Male Resident

attributes.content: Every time I had to see that shitty face of his, it was all I could do to keep from punching it in. He never gave anyone the time of day. Why would we care about him?
attributes.name: Male Resident

attributes.content: Look, half my flat got burned down. I don't have the time to worry about some guy. I'm busy. Now leave me alone.
attributes.name: Male Resident

attributes.content: There aren’t many of us in this building, so we all know each other, more or less...
attributes.name: Female Resident

attributes.content: But that guy never talked to anyone. He never left his room during the day, either, so nobody knew much about him...
attributes.name: Female Resident

attributes.content: I met that uncle once. He was really big! He was like thiiiiiis tall!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: He smiled at me and gave me a candy, too!
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Huh? Was he an uncle or a grandpa? I'm not too sure...
attributes.name: Little Girl

attributes.content: Mio! How many times have I told you not to accept things from strangers?!
attributes.name: Female Resident

attributes.content: I'm sorry, we can't help you. We have some errands to run. Bye now.
attributes.name: Female Resident

attributes.content: I talked to a lot of people, but no one knew anything about the man.
It was like the fire burned away every trace of his life, like he never existed at all.
No, this isn't in my job description. I can't write about this here...
Oh? If you want an appraisal on your collectibles, you need to make a reservation with the postal collectible specialists, and I'm about to clock out...
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: No, that'snotit! I'mverysorry, Ijustwantedtoask, wouldyoubeable totellanythingaboutitsowner justbylooking atthestampalbum?
attributes.name: Shaw

attributes.content: What do you mean by that... It's not yours?
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: Alright, alright. Slow down. Hand it over.
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: Hm... You don't see a collection like this very often.
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: Not really. It's just strange. Why would someone collect stamps like this?
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: When people collect stamps, they’re usually either limited edition stamps or stamps that have some special significance, right?
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: But the stamps in here are all very common. There's no value in it whatsoever.
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: I can't tell you what the collector was thinking. The stamps' themes and years are all jumbled up, and he kept both postmarked and non-postmarked stamps together...
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: A lot of it has Kou-wu landscapes, though. Look, from this page onwards, it's all Kou-wu sceneries.
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: Now this 'Hui-ch'i Foothills' one is a classic. If my memory serves, it was issued a couple decades ago? They printed a lot of them, though, so it's not worth that much money.
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: That aside, I couldn’t tell you what's so special about this collection.
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: If you wanted to learn something about the owner from the collection, I'm afraid there's not much.
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: If I had to give you an answer, maybe he likes the landscapes in Kou-wu?
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: Come in, come in. Take a seat anywhere.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: What? Girl, go ahead and ask every restaurant in Lungmen. See if anyone dares to say they serve more authentic Kou-wunese food than me?!
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: People from Kou-wu? Of course. We've served many Kou-wunese expats here. All of them say our food takes them right back home.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: If you don't believe me, why don’t you try it yourself?
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: He... HewasprobablyKou-wuese... Areallytallman, andprobablykindofhardup. Heprobablylookedalittleangry... maybenot... buthewouldcomefodinner intheevenings, otherwisealwayskeepingtohimself...
attributes.name: Shaw

attributes.content: You said... it was a tall guy?
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: That rings a bell... Yes, it does. There's a customer like that.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: Yeah... He’s a regular, sort of.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: It's just like you said. He always comes by himself, and always around midnight just before closing. I always have to stick around an extra hour for him.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: He never orders much, either. Just a finbeast and a small side dish. A thing of liquor, too. He hangs around a little after he's done before heading on home.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: Yeah, he looks real scary, but he's not a bad fella. Helps me clean up once he's done, too. Sometimes he talks about home when he's had a little too much to drink.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: Friends or family? He never told me about them, but he certainly doesn't seem like he's married.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: If you want to know, I could ask him for you next time? Wait, no, this is a customer's privacy we're talking about... *Sigh*... You'll just have to ask him yourself.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: Won't be back again? No way. He loves my food. He's one of the ones I was talking about, always saying my cooking reminds them of home.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: You're right, though. I haven’t seen him in a while...
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: I wonder what that young man's been up to.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: Right, he's a young man. Maybe a little older than you, but probably not by much.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: Now this 'Hui-ch'i Foothills' one is a classic. If my memory serves, it was issued a couple decades ago?
attributes.name: Post Office Worker

attributes.content: Hey, hey now, girl. Why are you crying, all of a sudden? A-Are you looking for family?
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: A-Alright, the next time he shows up, I'll ask him every last detail. Don't cry, okay?
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: Hey, speak of the devil. Now you pop in, eh, kid? Look at this girl, she's been asking after you, even started crying.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: I have no idea what's going on, but help me out here.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: 'Hui-ch'i Foothills...' I grew up in a small town at the base of Mount Hui-ch'i. A place just like this.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: I even remember this small pond behind the mountain. All the finbeasts we ate when I was a kid were from there.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: You can buy the freshest fins at the docks here, but there aren't any great fishing spots like that pond.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: It's been years since I've been home, but the place still looks just as lovely as always, at least on these stamps.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Kou-wu isn't a big place, and there's not that many people there either. But, I can’t say I know him.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: That said, now that you told me all this, I guess he doesn't feel a total stranger to me anymore. What a thorough girl you are, though. Not even we were this meticulous in our investigation.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Hard to say... but he was probably homesick.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: So you took the stamp album because you wanted to find his family?
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Why are you so obsessed with him?
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Shaw, I'll say this no matter how many times it takes. You've done your job. Under those circumstances, no one could've done better, not even you yourself.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: I can't tell you that's a wrong way to think, but with this kind of baggage, can you really throw yourself into the next fire without hesitating?
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Alright, I've said enough. This is something you have to figure out. I’m in no position to lecture you.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: It's chilly tonight. Head home soon.
attributes.name: Senior L.G.D. Officer

attributes.content: Today's the last day of my vacation. I did something really embarrassing.
In the end, I couldn't find anything about the man. I don't know what to do to pull myself together, but I still have more important work.
Today's my first day back on the job.
I've fallen behind on my training, so I gotta catch up. I might've caught a cold, and I need to get better!
Wemustalwayskeepinmind howtoproperlyescape thesceneofafire, butintheend, themosteffectivewaytofightfires isbypreventingthemfromhappening inthefirstplace.
attributes.name: Shaw

attributes.content: UnlikeCatastrophes, it'susuallypeople whostartfires, butittakesmorethan ourwillpoweralone tostopfires.
attributes.name: Shaw

attributes.content: Hey, Skyfire. Is it just me or did the squirt sound like she was kinda nervous that whole talk?
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Shh—Listen to her. She's telling this to you, specifically. Now stop interrupting!
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: As if she doesn’t mean you—
attributes.name: Ifrit

attributes.content: Still, she looks kinda sad, though. What should we do? Cheer her up, maybe?
attributes.name: Ifrit
